# AdditionalConfig checks in core

<DecisionHeader status="proposed" lastUpdate="2022-12-08" created="2022-12-08" deciders={["rishabhpoddar", "sattvikc"]} proposedBy={["sattvikc"]} />

## Context and Problem Statement

Should the additionalConfig (such as `hd` for google workspaces, `keyId`, `teamId` etc for apple) validated in core?

## Considered Options

* Validate in core
* No provider specific validation in core


## Decision Outcome

Chosen option: **No provider specific validation in core**, because

* Allows easy addition of new providers

We still add generic checks to the core and leave all the provider specific validation to the SDK

## Pros and Cons of the Options

### Validate in core

<ArgumentPro> Reduces run time error by ensuring that the correct config is added to the database </ArgumentPro>
<ArgumentCon> Core updates are necessary when adding new providers </ArgumentCon>

### No provider specific validation in core

<ArgumentPro> Allows easy addition of new providers in SDK, without the need for core upgrade </ArgumentPro>
<ArgumentCon> Invalid configs may cause more runtime errors </ArgumentCon>

The mentioned con is not too much of a problem as the error message will be indicative of the need for correction in the database
